medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports developing pain in the RUQ since the evening prior to admission after eating a meal. He described the pain as constant cramping with no relieving factors. He had intermittent nausea with forced emesis on the morning of presentation. No fever or chills were noted. He has had 2 similar episodes in the last few weeks after eating that resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital bicuspid aortic valve diagnosed as a child, reportedly with some regurgitation and 'perforations' in the past few years. Asymptomatic otherwise. Past surgical history includes knee surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of heart disease. Mother recently diagnosed with lung cancer. Several relatives with DM2. No known family history of gall bladder disease or gallstones.
